message.entry: Minimum and maximum limit of y-axis
Plot input signal as magnitude and phase
Enter number of inputs as a positive integer less than or equal to 96.
Enter [ymin ymax], where ymin and ymax are finite scalars.
Enter sample increment as a finite positive scalar.
Enter offset as a finite scalar.
Enter custom data as a real finite monotonically increasing vector.
X-Scale cannot be "Log" when the offset value is negative.
Offset value cannot be negative when X-Scale is "Log".
X-Scale cannot be "Log" when the Custom X-Data has negative values.
Custom X-Data cannot have negative values when X-Scale is "Log".
Enter data display precision as a finite positive real scalar between 1 and 15.
Sample increment must be a finite, positive, numeric scalar.
When the XScale property is set to "Log", the XOffset property value must be nonnegative. Change the XScale property value to "Linear" before setting a negative value to XOffset.
Custom X-data must be a real, finite, monotonically increasing, numeric vector.
When the XScale property is set to "Log", the CustomXData property must be nonnegative. Change the XScale property value to "Linear" before setting negative values to CustomXData.
When the XOffset property value is negative, the XScale property value must be "Linear". Set a nonnegative value to the XOffset property before setting XScale to "Log".
When the CustomXData property has negative values, the XScale property value must be "Linear". Set a nonnegative vector to the CustomXData property before setting XScale to "Log".
XScale property cannot be "Log" when the XOffset property value is negative. Change XScale to "Linear" or set XOffset to a positive value before setting XDataMode to "Sample increment and X-offset".
XScale property cannot be "Log" when the CustomXData property has negative values. Change XScale to "Linear" or set CustomXData to a positive numeric vector before setting XDataMode to "Custom".
The YLimits property value must be a 2-element finite numeric vector with the second element greater than the first element.
All data points are not displayed. Increase the length of 'CustomXData' to be greater than or equal to the input frame size.
In this configuration of the object, the {0} property is not applicable.
Changing the value of the non-tunable property {0} is not allowed without first calling the release() method.
The ActiveDisplay property must be a valid display number.
The LayoutDimensions property must be a 2-element numeric vector with each element greater than 0 and no greater than 10.
